spec.description: Install the OpenShift Serverless Operator to deploy stateless, event-trigger-based applications.
spec.introduction:
Red Hat OpenShift® Serverless lets you run stateless, serverless workloads on a single multi-cloud container platform.

  • Serverless reduces the need to manage infrastructure or perform back-end development. Scaling is automated, and applications can run on any cloud, hybrid, or on-premises environment.
  • Choosing Serverless means simplicity, portability, and efficiency.
  • Adding OpenShift Serverless to your OpenShift Container Platform cluster is quick and easy. This quick start walks you through the process.

tasks.title: Install the OpenShift Serverless Operator
tasks.description:
To install the Serverless Operator:

  1. From the Administrator perspective, go to the OperatorHub from the [Operators]{{highlight qs-nav-operators}} section of the navigation.
  2. In the Filter by keyword field, type Serverless.
  3. Look for Red Hat OpenShift Serverless. If the tile has an Installed label on it, the Operator is already installed. Proceed to task two.
  4. Click the tile to open the side panel.
  5. At the top of the side panel, click Install.
  6. Verify that the OpenShift Serverless Operator Update Channel is set to the latest version, then click Install.
  7. Wait for the OpenShift Serverless Operator's status to change from Installing operator to Operator installed - Ready for use.

review.instructions:
Verify that the OpenShift Serverless Operator is installed:

  • In the Status column of the Installed Operators page, is the OpenShift Serverless Operator’s status Operator installed - Ready for use?

tasks.title: Create the Knative Serving API
tasks.description:
Install the Knative Serving application program interface (API) needed to support deploying and serving your serverless applications and functions.

To create the Knative Serving API:
  1. In the main navigation menu, click Operators > Installed Operators.
  2. Click the Red Hat OpenShift Serverless Operator.
  3. In the Project dropdown menu, select knative-serving. If that project doesn’t exist, click Create Project and complete the process to create the knative-serving project.
  4. In the Provided APIs column, click Knative Serving.
  5. Click Create Knative Serving.
  6. Click Create to create the custom resource using the default settings.

review.instructions:
Verify that the Knative Serving API was installed successfully:

  • Under the Knative Serving tab, click the knative-serving custom resource. Scroll down to the Conditions section to see a list of condition types.

  • Does each condition type have a status of True?

Note: If the condition types have a status of False, wait a few minutes to allow the Knative Serving resources creation process to complete. You can check the status in the Resources tab.

tasks.title: Create the Knative Eventing API
tasks.description:
Install the Knative Eventing application program interface (API) needed to create event producers and consumers for your serverless applications.

To create the Knative Eventing API:
  1. In the main navigation menu, click Operators > Installed Operators.
  2. Click the Red Hat OpenShift Serverless Operator.
  3. In the Project dropdown menu, select knative-eventing. If that project doesn’t exist, click Create Project and complete the process to create the knative-eventing project.
  4. In the Provided APIs column, click Knative Eventing.
  5. Click Create Knative Eventing.
  6. Click Create to create the custom resource using the default settings.

review.instructions:
Verify that the Knative Eventing API was installed successfully:

  • Under the Knative Eventing tab, click the knative-eventing custom resource. Scroll down to the Conditions section to see a list of condition types.

  • Does each condition type have a status of True?

Note: If the condition types have a status of False, wait a few minutes to allow the Knative Eventing resources creation process to complete. You can check the status in the Resources tab.
